notes.text:
This update for rubygem-puppet fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2017-10689: Reset permissions when unpacking tar in PMT.
  When using minitar, files were unpacked with whatever permissions are
  in the tarball. This is potentially unsafe, as tarballs can be easily
  created with weird permissions
  (bsc#1080288)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: In previous versions of Puppet Agent it was possible to install a module with world writable permissions. Puppet Agent 5.3.4 and 1.10.10 included a fix to this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
